ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is very good for a student with little or no knowledge of database system because the course covered many aspects of the DB system. In addition, the assignments are very helpful for one to gain deeper grasp of how db systems work.
Yes. Database is really helpful for students who want to study systems.
Yes. It's useful for database magt

It's a good overview of relational databases. I'd recommend it to anyone that hasn't worked much with them before, and even people that have worked with them informally would likely benefit from the more rigorous introduction that this course provides.

Definitely take it. Its an easy class but you learn stuff. The only problem is in the starting, you don't have any work; but towards the end, you have two big assignments due which take up a lot of time and the assignments require a lot of reading and thinking. It is manageable though. The good thing was both the professor and the TA were flexible and understanding.
If you haven't learned database before, it's really a good course. Otherwise, you might find it not as rewarding and interesting.
I would recommend it to who is interested in relational database

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The basis for work in the future
I think the course is useful for any students in the department including me.
Databases are a hugely important topic and they're not going away any time soon. This course provides a good baseline level of understanding of their structure, operation, and usage.
A door to the database world
I hope it will be useful in future.
